contents.subtext: By  Wesley van Eeden, Nick Mulgrew, and Jennifer Jacobs

contents.text: Small Bird is a small bird. He is very small and very birdy.

Small Bird lives in a beautiful house with the Giant. Small Bird loves the Giant very much.
She is a kind Giant.
She give Small Bird lots of toys.
Small Bird is sad when the Giant wasn’t around.
So one day Small Bird went to go find the Giant.

Small Bird flew up and up until he could see the whole world.

He wants to find the Giant. Where would he land?

Small Bird lands in a huge forest, filled with trees and flowers and treasure.
Small Bird loves playing with the shiny jewels! But where was the Giant?

Small Bird walks into a vast field of snow. The snow is white and soft.
Small Bird loves rolling around on the cool ground. But where was the Giant?

This time, Small Bird flew even higher into the sky.

He flew among the stars and galaxies! He saw the moon! He saw a comet!

But where was the Giant?

From way up high, with his sharp birdy eyes, Small Bird saw something!
What could it be?
Small Bird dives down, down, down. Where will he land?

Small Bird lands right in the Giant’s hands! He is so happy to see her.

“I love you, Giant!” he shrieks.

The Giant holds Small Bird close to her.
“I love you too,” the Giant said.
